etymology.description: Pictogram; depiction uncertain—possibly plant roots underground (cf. 荄) or an animal akin to 豕.
etymology.interpretation: Early scribes likely drew a compact, enclosed form that could suggest either spreading roots beneath the soil or the outline of a squat animal. Its graphic form was later conventionalized and assigned to the twelfth Earthly Branch, culturally linked with the pig in the zodiac.

examples.chinese: 十二地支中(十二地支中)，亥代表猪(亥代表豬)。
examples.pinyin: Shí'èr dìzhī zhōng, hài dàibiǎo zhū.
examples.english: In the twelve Earthly Branches, Hài represents the pig.

examples.chinese: 古人把晚上九点到十一点(古人把晚上九點到十一點)称为亥时(稱為亥時)。
examples.pinyin: Gǔrén bǎ wǎnshang jiǔ diǎn dào shíyī diǎn chēngwéi hàishí.

examples.chinese: 他出生在己亥年(他出生在己亥年)，性格温和(性格溫和)。
examples.pinyin: Tā chūshēng zài jǐhàinián, xìnggé wēnhé.
examples.english: He was born in the jǐ-hài year and has a gentle temperament.
